CHRONOLOGICAL.Definition: following the order in which the events happened

PATIENT.Definition: able to accept the difficulties of such a journey

REIGN.Definition: period of being a king, ruling

TENDENCY.Definition: habit, something that we are very likely to do

GENETIC.Definition: relating to genes (parts of the DNA) received from our parents

HEIR.Definition: the next person to have this position

REMOTELY.Definition: slightly, in a very small way

MONARCH-IN-WAITING.Definition: someone who was going to be king

HEIR APPARENT.Definition: the next person to have this position undeniably

BOARDING SCHOOL.Definition: a school where students study but also live

ROUGH AND TUMBLE.Definition: involving intense physical activity and contact

ELITIST.Definition: meant for a limited amount of people

ROUGH-AND-READY.Definition: physical playing that involves noisy and slightly violent behaviour

PRECONCEIVED.Definition: formed too early, without enough evidence

DISGRACED.Definition: having fallen from favour or a position of honour

HUG.Definition: holding him close with their arms

NURTURE.Definition: care for him and protect him as he was growing

STITCHES.Definition: loops or knots of thread used in closing a wound

TABLOID.Definition: small-sized newspaper often focusing on gossip

SPECULATION.Definition: conclusion or opinion expressed without proof or enough evidence

HYPOCRISY.Definition: the condition of him pretending to be or acting like he was something he was not

PRACTISE WHAT HE PREACHES.Definition: act according to what he says

HYPOCRITE.Definition: someone who pretends to be or acts like he is something he is not

CONSTITUTIONAL MONARCHY.Definition: the system of government in which a king or a queen shares power with a constitutionally organised government

IN THE SHADOW OF.Definition: in a condition in which he felt he could never be as good as her

ACUTELY.Definition: in a way that shows a deep understanding

PUBLIC PERCEPTION.Definition: the opinion of people about him

REASSURANCE.Definition: a condition that removes his doubts or fears

CONTRADICTION.Definition: a situation in which very different things are present

GET HIS WAY.Definition: get or do what he wanted

ADJUSTMENT.Definition: process of changing or becoming used to the new situation
